Sentencas: The oxygen electrode reaction at the Pt/yttria-stabilised zirconia (YSZ) interface is investigated at 1000 degreesC on Pt point electrodes on YSZ and YSZ point contacts on Pt. Linear potential sweeps show a pronounced non-linear current-voltage relation and inductive hysteresis, in particular at low sweep rates (similar to 1 muV S-1).
Titulo: Hysteresis in the solid oxide fuel cell cathode reaction

Sentencas: Correspondingly, an inductive behaviour is observed at low frequency by impedance measurements on polarised electrodes.
Titulo: Hysteresis in the solid oxide fuel cell cathode reaction

Sentencas: The behaviour is attributed to a current-induced activation mechanism and subsequent deactivation at equilibrium conditions.
Titulo: Hysteresis in the solid oxide fuel cell cathode reaction

Sentencas: Several mechanisms are discussed and rejected as responsible for the phenomena.
Titulo: Hysteresis in the solid oxide fuel cell cathode reaction

Sentencas: Finally, the stability of the triple phase boundary is questioned and a current-sensitive reaction zone geometry is suggested as an explanation for the behaviour.
Titulo: Hysteresis in the solid oxide fuel cell cathode reaction
